alert.note: Alert for Berkeley; Charleston (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued November 10 at 12:15PM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast South Carolina, including the following counties, Berkeley and Charleston. * WHEN...Until 200 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Water over roadways. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1214 PM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Flooding is ongoing across parts of Downtown Charleston where a combination of both fresh water and salt water flooding continues. The risk for flooding will continue through at least 2 PM as additional bands from Tropical Storm Nicole move onshore. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... North Charleston, Mount Pleasant, Downtown Charleston, James Island, Fort Sumter, Daniel Island, West Ashley, Folly Beach, Sullivan`s Island, Fort Johnson, Charleston Naval Complex, Charles Towne Landing, Sullivans Island, Marion Square, Columbus Street Terminal, Medical University Of South Carolina, Ravenel Bridge, Patriots Point and Mount Pleasant Waterfront Park.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Report flooding directly to the Charleston National Weather Service at 1-888-383-2024 or email your reports to nws.charlestonsc@noaa.gov.
